newsitem.title: JAPAN: Square founder to become T&E majority shareholder.
newsitem.headline: Square founder to become T&E majority shareholder.

text.p: Software company T&E Soft Inc said on Thursday that a founder and leading shareholder of game software maker Square Co Ltd would become T&E's majority shareholder at the end of next month.
The shares would be partly acquired through a third-party share allocation, T&E said in a statement.
Masafumi Miyamoto, who currently holds no shares in T&E, will buy 900,000 shares from T&E top executives and their families on April 1.

He will also buy 6.1 million new shares which T&E will issue for 554 yen per share in a third-party allocation of new shares on April 23, thereby acquiring a total stake in T&E of 79.55 percent, it said.
The funds to be raised through the new share issue will be used for the development and production of game software and game machines for game centres, T&E said.
Due to intensifying competition in the game industry, T&E suffered losses in recent years, the company said.
Miyamoto himself will not have dealings with T&E's management, T&E said.
Miyamoto currently holds a 52.4 percent stake in Square, which makes popular game software, including the "Final Fantasy" series.
